Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Dispute_Type: Procedural fairness in immigration and refugee protection
Legal_Provision_Involved: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), sections related to PRRA and procedural fairness
Outcome: Application allowed; matter remitted for re-determination by a different PRRA Officer
Grounds_for_Claim: Breach of duty of fairness by PRRA Officer
Remedy_Requested: Reconsideration of PRRA application with procedural fairness
Legal_Framework: Canadian administrative law, international human rights law, non-refoulement principle
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness, with considerations of procedural fairness
Evidence_Requirement: Disclosure of novel and significant country condition information
Decision_Outcome: Breach of procedural fairness found; decision set aside
Government_Body_or_Authority: Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC), PRRA Officer
Evidence_Type: Country condition reports, post-2009 documents on Sri Lanka's civil war
Individual_Status_or_Claim: Tamil individual fearing risk upon removal to Sri Lanka
Temporal_Context: Post-2009, after the end of Sri Lanka's civil war
Assessment_Standard: Whether novel and significant country conditions were disclosed
Complaint_Issues: Failure to disclose material country condition changes affecting risk assessment
Protected_Group: Tamil ethnic group, persons at risk of persecution
Legal_Standard: Duty of fairness in administrative decision-making
Protection_Claim: Risk of persecution or harm upon return to Sri Lanka
State_Protection_Assessment: Adequacy of state protection in Sri Lanka questioned due to post-war conditions
Risk_Factor: Ethnic affiliation, political climate in post-war Sri Lanka
Credibility: Not directly challenged; focus on procedural fairness
Legal_Provision: Section 115 of IRPA (PRRA), principles of natural justice
State_Protection_Adequacy: Contested due to ongoing risks despite end of civil war
Risk_Nature: Risk of persecution, torture, or other serious harm
Claimant_Status: Permanent resident or foreign national in Canada
Perpetrator_Entity: State actors or non-state actors in Sri Lanka
Legal_Basis: Right to procedural fairness, non-refoulement under international law
Victim_Basis: Fear of persecution based on ethnicity and country conditions
